intro: Parodia mueller-melchersii subsp. winkleri, commonly known as the Winkler’s Parodia, is a compact, slow-growing cactus native to southern Africa. It features a short, cylindrical stem with a distinctive greenish-gray color and a slightly ribbed texture. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers during the summer months, typically at the base of the stem. It is well adapted to arid environments, with thick, fleshy stems that store water. Its unique appearance and hardy nature make it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
